titleStmt.title: The maids petition. To the Honourable members of both Houses. Or The humble petition of many thousands of the well-affected, within and without the lines of communication, virgins, maids, and other young women not married, &c. And in the behalf of the whole kingdome, for their lawfull dayes of recreation. With their declaration, to hold out stifly, and to comply with the apprentices or others for their tollerable tolleration. Presented on Tuesday the 9. of August the 2d. recreation day for apprentices, 1647.

The maids petition. To the Honourable members of both Houses. Or The humble petition of many thousands of the well-affected, within and without the lines of communication, virgins, maids, and other young women not married, &c. And in the behalf of the whole kingdome, for their lawfull dayes of recreation. With their declaration, to hold out stifly, and to comply with the apprentices or others for their tollerable tolleration. Presented on Tuesday the 9. of August the 2d. recreation day for apprentices, 1647.

publicationStmt.date: in the yeer of Englands freedome and liberty, 1647.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
